did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Printed Materials, Publications, Reports, Research Materials,Correspondence
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, memos, meeting minutes, proposals, budget material, photographs, Project Ezra and Project Mandarin records, John Rudan's files and other records that document the history of computing at Cornell University.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1966 the Cornell Computing Center and Machine Records were merged into the Office of Computer Services (OCS), and in 1970 the business systems group was split from OCS to form Management Systems and Analysis (MSA), which was merged back into OCS in 1978. In 1980 OCS became CCS, Cornell Computing Services, and in that decade was a partner with the Theory Center in creating and sustaining the Cornell National Supercomputer Facility. In 1988 the service organization became the Cornell Information Technologies, with the vice president's office, OIT, the Office of Information Technology, assuming responsibility for overall IT policy on campus.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, memos, meeting minutes, proposals, budget material, photographs, Project Ezra and Project Mandarin records, John Rudan's files and other records that document the history of computing at Cornell University.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University.Division of Management Systems and Analysis.Office of Institutional Information.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS
descgrp.p: Additional material and digital versions can be found online here: http://ecommons.cornell.edu/handle/1813/82
